III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or around 4/14/23, youth was sexually abused by another
youth at the facility when he was pulled into the shower by the
other youth. Youth was reaching underneath the show stall and
made inappropriate comments to youth.
Investigation Interviews
Therapist Z/Complainant was interviewed via TEAMS on April
20, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Therapist Z
said she was the on-call therapist the weekend of April 15, 2023.
Therapist Z said she had received a call regarding an incident with
Youth A at Putnam on April 14, 2023, which resulted in Youth A
being placed on a safety plan. Therapist Z said on April 15, 2023,
she followed up with Youth A to process what had occurred the
night prior. Therapist Z said while talking with Youth A he
disclosed that he had been sexually assaulted while placed at
Hainley (this is being investigated under SIR 2023C0000396).
Therapist Z said that Youth B “sexually abused” him in the shower
on April 14, 2023, when staff were not looking. Therapist Z said
Youth A told her Youth B “grabbed him and pulled him in the
shower”. Therapist Z said Youth A did not go into any additional
detail at the time and she did not ask any other questions due to
knowing there would be a full investigation. Therapist Z said after
talking with Youth A he had a visit with his parents and asked she
tell them about the incidents. Therapist Z said Youth A was
present when she told the parents what he had disclosed to her as
well as what Supervisor reported Youth A had disclosed to him.
Therapist Z said Youth A did not deny or try to change what he
had told Supervisor. Therapist Z said Youth A’s father had no
reaction and his mother just was concerned that Youth A was kept
safe, and a safety plan was in place and followed for him.
Therapist Z said Youth A was very preoccupied with his
“consequences” from the shower incident and repeatedly stated
he wanted to be able to play his PS5 and be off grounding.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
18, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth A
said he was previously placed at Hainley and is currently placed at
Putnam. Youth A said “on Friday” he was taking a shower at the
same time as Youth B when Youth B came into his shower stall
2

and “sexually abused” him. Youth A was unable to give any details
of this incident. Youth A was asked if Staff 1 saw him crawling
under a shower stall door to which Youth A replied yes. Youth A
said he got into his shower and realized he needed to use the
bathroom “really bad” and so crawled under the shower stall door
and used the bathroom. Youth A said once he was done using the
bathroom he went to get back into his shower and realized his
stall door was locked so had to crawl back under it and that was
when Staff 1 saw him. Youth A said it was then that he told Staff 1
about Youth B sexually assaulting him. Youth A said he is now on
a safety plan with five-minute checks and does not think that is fair
and does not want to be on a safety plan. Youth A said he is also
grounded and therefore cannot play his PS5 and feels that is also
unfair. Youth A said he told Foster Care Worker about the sexual
assault with Youth B “right away”. Youth A denied telling
Supervisor that he was the one that attempted to sexually assault
Youth B. Youth A denied ever attempting to sexually touch Youth
B or any other youth.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
18, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B
said over the weekend he was taking a shower and Youth A tried
to “crawl under the stall” but he “kicked him out”. Youth B said no
staff were around, so he began to call for staff, however no one
came. Youth B said Youth A reached to try to touch his penis but
was not able to reach far enough to touch him. Youth B said he
told Supervisor the same night it happened. Youth B said this was
the first time Youth A has tried to sexually touch him however
previously they have gotten into verbal and physical altercations
because Youth A is “mean to him”. Youth B said Youth C told him
that Youth A tried to sexually touch him one time while they were
outside. Youth B said he is unaware of any other youth that Youth
A has been sexually inappropriate with.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
19, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth C
said he is currently placed with Youth A and they do not get along
because Youth A “says mean stuff when staff aren’t listening”.
Youth C said Youth A is mean to all of the youth at Putnam. Youth
C denied ever being outside without staff supervising. Youth C
denied ever touching or attempting to touch him sexually. Youth C
said if Youth A did ever attempt to touch him he would tell
Therapist Y right away.
Therapist Y was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 18, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
3

Therapist Y said Youth A recently moved from Hainley to Putnam
and therefore she is just starting to get to know him. Therapist Y
said she had no knowledge of any sexual assaults or abuse of
Youth A while he was at Hainley. Therapist Y said Youth A does
have history of being sexually abused while in his mother’s care
as well as in a previous residential placement, not Eagle Village.
Therapist Y said Youth A has never disclosed any sexual assaults
to her. Therapist said she is not aware of any sexual acting out
behaviors with Youth A other than a “moaning” he will do at times
which upsets his peers but appeared more like a behavioral issue
rather than a sexual issue. Therapist Y said she talked to Foster
Care Worker after she had met with Youth A and Foster Care
Worker did not tell her that Youth A disclosed anything about
sexual abuse in their meeting. Therapist Y said she is also the
therapist for Youth B, and he has never disclosed anything at all
regarding Youth A to her.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 18, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Supervisor said he was working on Friday with Staff 1 and Youth
A, Youth B, and Youth C. Supervisor said that Staff 1 was
supervising Youth A and Youth B in the shower while Youth C was
doing “reflection time”. Supervisor said he was standing by Staff 1
talking when they noticed Youth A looking through the crack of his
shower stall at staff. Supervisor said he thought that was odd and
so told Youth A he had five minutes to finish up his shower.
Supervisor said he directed Staff 1 to stand to the side of the
hallway so they could still see the shower area, but the youth
could not see them. Supervisor said at that point Youth A looked
under his door and said “Hey [Youth B]” and Staff 1 redirected
Youth A telling him “No talking during showers” to which Youth A
said “ok”. Supervisor said a few moments later Youth A was
crawling under his shower stall door saying “[Youth B] do you
want to have sex with me?” Supervisor said he immediately
intervened and told Youth A to get his things as his shower time
was over. Supervisor said Youth C had been walking down the
hallway at the same time Youth A was crawling under his shower
door and witnessed the incident as well. Supervisor said after
Youth A got dressed, he took him aside and asked him about the
incident. Supervisor said Youth A must have thought Youth C told
him about it and immediately started telling him that Youth C “is a
liar and lying about the shower”. Supervisor said he did not
engage any further as Youth A was clearly upset but later talked
to him in the staff office. Supervisor said during that conversation
he asked Youth A why he would attempt to crawl under the
shower door and ask Youth B to have sex, to which Youth A
4

stated he did not understand why staff “are making such a big
deal about it” as he “fucked a couple kids over there [Hainley
House] and they turned out fine” (This is being investigated in SIR
2023C0000396). Supervisor said he told Youth A he wanted to
keep all the youth safe at Putnam, telling him he will be on a
safety plan and need to keep a safe distance from Youth B to
which Youth A replied, “that’s fine I’ll do it when no one is looking”.
Supervisor said Youth A told him that Youth B is “easy” which is
why he picked him to ask about having sex. Supervisor said he
had no prior information that Youth A had sexually inappropriate
behaviors with other youth at Hainley or any other placement.
Supervisor said he has never had any issues with Youth B acting
out sexually. Supervisor said he has no knowledge of Youth A and
Youth C being sexually inappropriate. Supervisor said Youth A
and Youth B were put on a safety plan after this incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 18,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said he
was supervising Youth A and Youth B while they were taking
showers on April 14, 2023. Staff 1 said Youth A was just finishing
his shower and Youth B was just getting started when he heard
Youth A talking to Youth B. Staff 1 said he told Youth A he is not
allowed to be talking to peers while showering. Staff 1 said Youth
A then was seen out of his shower stall reaching under Youth B’s
shower stall, asking Youth B to have sex with him. Staff 1 said he
directed Youth A to gather his things and leave the shower area.
Staff 1 said he told Supervisor about the incident right away. Staff
1 said he has never heard Youth A making any sexual comments
to peers previously. Staff 1 said he is not aware of Youth A having
inappropriate sexual issues with any other youth. Staff 1 said he
has never had any concerns with Youth B having inappropriate
sexual issues with any other youth. Staff 1 said both Youth A and
Youth B have been placed on safety plans since this incident.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on April
20, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Foster Care
Worker said she conducted a face-to-face visit with Youth A on
April 17, 2023. Foster Care Worker said during the visit Youth A
told her that Youth B had sexually abused him and that he was not
the one to attempt to engage in the sexual behaviors. Foster Care
Worker said Youth A was very focused on having her believe what
he was saying and not what the staff had previously told her.
Foster Care Worker said Youth A repeatedly stated “[Supervisor]
needs to forgive me for my mistakes and bad habits” but never
describing what his mistakes or bad habits are. Foster Care
Worker said Youth A was very focused with trying to get off
5

grounding so he could be off five-minutes checks and play video
games again. Foster Care Worker said Youth A never disclosed
what the sexual abuse was with Youth B however did state that
Youth A disclosed that Youth C “put his penis in [Youth A’s] ass”
in the living room downstairs. Foster Care Worker said this was
this first time Youth A disclosed any sexual allegations to her
about Eagle Village, however said he had been sexually abused
at a previous placement.
Documents Reviewed
• Youth A’s Safety Plan dated April 14, 2023. The safety plan
noted “sexualized behaviors” as the reason for the plan,
and “close obs” as the type of plan. The safety plan outlines
the supervision expectations for staff to increase their
checks on Youth A and stay in close proximity of him. The
plan prevents Youth A to shower at the same time as other
youth and requires staff supervision when interacting with
peers.
• Youth B’s Safety Plan dated April 15, 2023. The safety plan
noted “alleged sexual misconduct” as the reason for the
plan, and “close obs” as the type of plan. The safety plan
outlines the supervision expectations for staff to increase
their checks on Youth B and stay in close proximity of him.
The plan prevents Youth B to shower at the same time as
other youth and requires staff supervision when interacting
with peers.
• Youth C’s Safety Plan dated April 15, 2023. The safety plan
noted “alleged sexual misconduct” as the reason for the
plan, and “close obs” as the type of plan. The safety plan
outlines the supervision expectations for staff to increase
their checks on Youth C and stay in close proximity of him.
The plan prevents Youth C to shower at the same time as
other youth and requires staff supervision when interacting
with peers.
• Supervisor Personnel File: There was one disciplinary
action dated March 9, 2021, for an unwarranted restraint
with a youth. Supervisor completed incident reporting
training on December 7, 2022.
• Staff 1’s Personnel File: There is no disciplinary record on
file. Staff 1 completed incident reporting training on January
21, 2022, and PREA training on January 19, 2022.
• Incident Report dated April 14, 2023 regarding the incident
when Youth A attempted to crawl under Youth B’s shower
stall door. The incident report is consistent with Staff 1,
Supervisor, and Therapist Z’s interviews.
6

• Eagle Village Supervision of Residents Policy and
Procedure which outlines the expectations of staff to
supervise youth and to ensure checks are completed when
youth are showering or using the bathroom.
Tour Observation
A tour of Putnam occurred on April 19, 2023. The bathroom is the
first doorway to the left in the hallway off the main living area. The
bathroom is an open layout with two stalls that have a changing
space and shower inside. The stall doors have about a foot of
open space at the bottom. Staff 1 showed me where he was
standing which was in the entryway of the bathroom area and had
direct visibility of both shower stalls.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Program Statement. Staff 1
and Supervisor were supervising Youth A and Youth B
appropriately, completed an incident report as required, and
reported the incident to the proper individuals.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
